f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal offers to create documentation about the query specification of Ouroboros-mini, by going over the Haskell code and translating into conventional language.
The proposer does not prove that there is a lack of documentation, and I have been able to find quite quickly detailed information about ouroboros-mini, including query specification. Examples here: https://ogmios.dev/mini-protocols/ or https://hydra.iohk.io/build/1070091/download/1/network.pdf#chapter.3 or https://input-output-hk.github.io/ouroboros-network/ouroboros-network/Ouroboros-Network-NodeToClient.html
Maybe it is not enough, but the proposer should demonstrate what is lacking in existing documentation.
Considering that the problem is not well stated and demonstrated I disagree that this proposal addresses effectively the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims he is a Haskell developer but does not provide evidence of this skill. Besides he does not describe how he will organize the work, or how is evaluated the 2 months project timeline. To improve the feasibility score, the proposer could consider adding information about the quantity of code that has to be translated for example, and include intermediate milestones.
f6_assessments.q2: Very little detail is provided on how the community will be informed of the progress of the work. The proposal could be improved with a commitment to weekly updates for example.
